lines.text: The widow of David Furness faced a questioning world. Why should a man - happy as David was - take his own life - - ?
Dear Constance, one doesn't know Diana these days. She's déclassé - if you know what I mean. But I will say for Diana - once a man loves her - he never forgets her.
Constance is outside. Will you go and talk to her? It was only honorable to bring her along.

[Sarcastically]
Oh, yes - honor. We mustn't forget that.
What difference does it make? What difference does anything make?
